reviews.review_msg: harsh instructor with a tendency to use abusive and abrasive language
terrible instructor, infantalizing/condesending, look down upon people of color despite her apparent appearence of a woman of asian descent. talking tostudent with abrasive language

Lots of weekly work that isn't worth much... crazy long exams (the midterm was 16 full pages of multiple essays). The layout was very straight forward, the papers and documentaries were interesting and engaging. It was online, and you can work ahead which is great if you have a busy schedule. Fair grader.
won't take her any more, bitter negative person
Not fair teacher. Can be so discriminatory to students with accecent. She herself uses fillers a lot, so annoying
Hardest exams ever. They're actually 14 page papers and TA is an extremely harsh marker.

Minimum 600 words per question. 3600 words or 14.5 pages. "Just a matter of pulling from your lecture and reading notes and shouldn't take more than 2 days". Not much material to work with. Lectures are basic, readings are mostly fluff articles. Why would a prof want word clutter and redundancy rather than a succinct, strong response?

This was such an interesting and informative class. Wendy's criteria is always clear so if you follow the instructions carefully it is not hard to get a good grade. You get a week to write each of the 2 takehome exams, and it consists of 6 questions where you must write a response, relying on course materials, between 550 & 750 words per questions

Very inconsiderate professor. Extremely cold, rude, and does not care about her students. Would never ever take a course with her again. If you do, you better hope your life is perfect for the semester as she will NOT accommodate. Can not say a single good thing. You can try so hard and get a terrible grade. Something needs to be done about her.

The topic is interesting, but it's going to be impossible to get a good grade even with tremendous effort. Lots of info but no clarification of what to focus on.  The content is one sided, so how good at you are regurgitating the perspective fed to you? Prof and TA seem like nice people - but incredibly harsh markers. Hard to stay motivated :(
tough but firm instructor, but grade unfair especially to those students of color.
to be honest, this prof. claimed to be a feminist, anti-racist, she is full of bias and prejudice.

I didn't mind the course content although the TA and prof were incredibly misunderstanding and rude when I had personal issues arise which prevented me from completing coursework. They were also very unwilling to provide realistic feedback for assignments. Don't bother taking a course with them.

Class was online but had a lot of reading and content to engage with. Class content was enjoyable but always graded harshly by the TA, feedback was of little to no help. If you need an elective to boost your GPA, this is not the class. I do not recommend!

This professor has no time to teach. All of her lectures and materials are reused from previous semesters, she does none of her own marking and offers only two zoom sessions through the entire term. The TA is a ridiculously hard marker who offers zero constructive feedback. Do not take this class.
Just an average sociology class. Grading is a little tough but the lectures are informative and packed with content. don't have much to say honestly. not very memorable.
Very interesting course content, taught in an engaging way. Exams are mini essays over a week period, and very relevant to course content. Loved this course and would definitely take it again.

I took distance education with her so it depends on how nice your TA is. Her lecture is ok, but for the final, it's basically writing about the same things 6 times and making it into 6 mini-essays. Good luck!

Wendy's lectures were enjoyable to listen to and very informative. She was nice and always accessible for help. However that's all I can say about her because the TA marked every assignment so couldn't get that much feedback, which was quite unfair. Paper wasn't too bad but weekly discussion posts and midterm/final were a pain.
Will never take her again.
Did not have a pleasant experience with this class online. Don't think I will take her classes in the future either.

Wendy is a tough grader, but she is a gem in the SA department at SFU. She is always willing to give useful feedback and her criteria is always clear. She expects a lot from her students, so you actually have to try hard to do well. However, she is also super understanding when you have personal problems that make your semester difficult.

Doesnt let you form your own ideas if they are in contrast with her own. Doesnt give decent feedback, unsure about exactly why she graded things the way she does. If you just come in, sit there, agree with her and leave you will easily pass, but I do not recommend Wendy Chan at all.

Wendy is a great prof and very knowledgable and if I was in Sociology I will take another class with her. Exam questions are provided ahead of time and the final was harder than I expected. The paper was 15 pages and a drag to write. Overall she is very friendly and approachable and gives good feedback!

Best professor I have had at SFU. Very passionate and engaging, which added to the awesome-ness of the class since the topic was super interesting. For the exams (2 midterms), her practice exams were tremendously helpful, they could not be any more helpful. The final paper, although 15 pages, was on an immigrant story so it was fun to write.

She's a hard marker because she doesn't really lay out what she expects from you, so you have either ask a lot of questions to get it out of her or have had taken her class before, to know what she wants. Midterms are fair. The classes are pretty engaging and she always ends the class with a movie. I personally, didn't like her as a prof...

I'll start off by saying the material of this class was extremely informative. That being said, the first in-class exam was a bit of a bomber. For a specific question, the expectations were not clear, thus a lot of students did worse than they thought they did (myself included). The paper is minimum 15-pages and it was a bit of a drag to write.

I didn't enjoy her but I didn't hate her either. She was helpful and responded to emails ASAP. She also listened to the classes suggestions which was great! I feel that her marking was fair and easy at times. The first midterm was hard but I think she marked easier on the second one. Overall, I would take another class with her! Loved her videos!

Wendy's lecture are interested because she incorporates notes and a video at the second half of the class. Just remember to do her commentaries which are due every single week and she requires you to bring in a story from the news or your personal experience about that week's topic
Really like Wendy, her lectures had a routine layout, she gave really good notes and articles, and was really nice and helpful! i took sa 335 & 345 with her.
Changed the required number of sources for the essay after everyone had handed their essays in already.  How is that fair?

Wendy is a great teacher! Sa 345 is by far the best class I have taken at SFU thanks to Wendy. Interesting lectures, related to the course, exams and paper. Even though it was a 4 hour class she was able to keep my attention. Easy marker, she even gives you the exam questions a week before the exam! And little to no group work, A+ Wendy.

Wendy lacks the intellectual confidence to accept opposing pts of view, and uses the class as a vehicle to force her very biased political beliefs. Shows OPEN DISDAIN for those who disagree. While marking is fair, I still bristle when I think of this class and how she pushes this politically correct White Guilt Complex. Just disgraceful.

Lectures and readings were interesting. Fair marker. Assignments are clear and concise. Not a hard class, but not easy. Uses quite a bit of filler words (yeah, like) which can be annoying at times. Overall, enjoyed her class. Good prof!
won't allow u to think outside the box

class is somewhat necessary. you the practice midterm questions the week prior, and they will be same questions that would show up on the midterm. as well take home final is same format. however the readings are very useful, as you will have to incorporate into final/midterm and paper assignment.

This is a gender class that was good up until Wendy was faced with questions with regards to why the course focuses on FEMINISM and why people have not converted to being one. This was an ok course, but needs revision. Her yah...is just as annoying as her over emphasis of feminism. Get over it Wendy...

This class was very interesting and very rewarding, if you're willing to put the effort in.  Potential exam questions were handed out in advance.  Papers were very specific (guided analysis).  She marks fairly and will penalize you if you bs.  She uses filler words consistently when she lectures (yeah, ok, right), which can sometimes be annoying.

tottaly just makes up stats and other BS to make you thing about what may really not be the truth. She also says "yeah" a whole lot, get use to it because it will get annoying to you trust me !!! dont take her you will feel very very lost!!

Wendy made the class very interesting,and overall it was easy...i object to claims that it was a hard class...there were no exams!!!! Just three papers she explained thoroughly :) I recommend her class.  Not an easy A, but definitely a class you will learn something in.
Wendy does a good job of presenting the material. Class discussion is encouraged. If you're a quiet person I don't recomment the class. A lot of the articles used were recent. No exams.
Chan's pretty generous with marking, assignments are pretty straightforward
No Comments
No Comments
marks way too hard... boring
